cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY 0? HIS SRITAMIC MAJESTY' S GOVERfflBM1, S E C RE T.CABINET;C.P. gjg (24)GMIVA PROTgCOL^OR THE PACIFIC SETTLEMENT "* OE INTERNATIONAL "DISPUTES, " :.NOTE BY THE SECRETARY.The attached Papers in regard to the Geneva Protocol for the Pacific Settlement of International Disputes, which have been circulated to the Members of the Committee of Imperial Defence in connection with the enquiry by that Committee into this subject) are circulated on the instructions of the Prime Minister for the information of those Members of the Cabinet who have not already received them as Members of the Committee of Imperial Defence.Copies of these papers are being forwarded for the personal information of the Prime Ministers of the Dominions.Attention is called particularly to the statement of the Lord President of the Council summarising the position, which is contained in the Minutes of the 190th Meeting of the Committee of Imperial Defence, held on the 4th December, 1924.The Minutes of the 192nd Meeting of the Committee of Imperial Defence held on the l6th December, 1924, at which meeting an important statement was made by the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, will be circulated shortly.(Signed) M. P. A. HANKEY,Secretary to the Cabinet.2 Whitehall Gardens, S.W.I.December 18th, 1924. 9 9 9 tji t)GENEVA PROTOCOL FOR THE PACIFIC SETTLEMENT " OF INTERNATIONAL' DlSPDW:SCHEDULE of Committee of Imperial Defence Papers attached hereto.I, Note by the Secretary, Committee of Imperial Defence, covering a Memorandum by the First Lord of tne Admiralty, dated Sept.27th 192^ (C.I,D. Paper No, 517-B).2. Note by the Secretary, Committee of Imperial Defence, covering a letter from the Foreign Office and League of Nations Documents relating to the Protocol, October--November, 1924a (C.I.D. Paper No, 526-B),So Joint Memorandum by the Three Chiefs of Staff, October 29th, 1924, (C.I.D. Paper No. 527-B),4, Memorandum by the President of the Board of Trade, November 24th, 1924.(O.I.D. Paper No. 556-B).55 Memorandum by the Treasury, November 26th, 1924. (C.I.D, Paper No. 557-3),6. Minute by Sir Eyre Crowe, November 17th, 1924, with various annexureSo(CIJ). Paper No. 538-3).V. Some Remarks on the Protocol by the Secretary, Committee of Imperial Defence, November 21st, 1924, (O.I.D. Paper No, 559-B).8. Memorandum by Mr, Campbell, Foreign Office, November 20th, 19-24. (CI^D. Paper No, 540-B),9, Note by the Secretary, Committee of Imperial Defence, covering a Memorandum by the First Lord of the Admiralty, October 27th, 1924. (0.1.Do Paper Mo. 541-B).10, Memorandum by the Secretary of State for Air, December 1st, 1924, (CLP, Paper No.. 542-B). -II, Memorandum by Lord Cecil, December 11th, 1924.(O.I.D. Paper No, 547-B),12, Minutes of the 190th Meeting of the Committee of Imperial Defence, held on December 4th, 1924.13, Extract from the Minutes of the 191st Meeting of the Committee of Imperial Defence, held on December 11th, 1924.14, Minutes of the 192nd Meeting of the Committee of ImperialDefence, held on December 16th, 1924, (To be circulated shortly).
